message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.CR

The paper proposes a new extension of Hidden Markov Models (HMM) for sequential labeling, which is a common problem in natural language processing (NLP) and computer vision (CV). Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.CL (Computation and Language), and cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also mentions the use of prior information, which is a common technique in Bayesian machine learning, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) a likely sub-category as well. Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed method on benchmark datasets, which suggests that it may also belong to cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
